<p>
TO <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=tba" rel="met child">THEODOSIA</a>.
</p><p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=washington" rel="city">Washington</a>, January 29, <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?year=1804">1804</a>.
</p><p>
There is no end to the trouble such a baggage gives me. Another thing
occurs, which, forsooth, must be sent to her too. It would not,
perhaps, merit so high an honour as that of being perused by
your----eyes and touched by your fair hands, but that it is the
production of a youth  of about nineteen, the youngest brother of
Dr. Peter Irving, of <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=new york" rel="city">New-York</a>,.
</p><p>
_Salut'.
</p><p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=aab" rel="me">A. BURR</a>.
</p>
